Summary Specialties: adobe acrobat, adobe photoshop, budgeting, customer relations, detail oriented, imaging, java, legal, macintosh os, mapinfo, matlab, meeting facilitation, microsoft excel, microsoft office, microsoft windows, problem solving, procurement, scanners, spss, sql, telephone skills, unix, user interface design, web site production, writing Summary Specialties: adobe acrobat, adobe photoshop, budgeting, customer relations, detail oriented, imaging, java, legal, macintosh os, mapinfo, matlab, meeting facilitation, microsoft excel, microsoft office, microsoft windows, problem solving, procurement, scanners, spss, sql, telephone skills, unix, user interface design, web site production, writing Specialties: adobe acrobat, adobe photoshop, budgeting, customer relations, detail oriented, imaging, java, legal, macintosh os, mapinfo, matlab, meeting facilitation, microsoft excel, microsoft office, microsoft windows, problem solving, procurement, scanners, spss, sql, telephone skills, unix, user interface design, web site production, writing Specialties: adobe acrobat, adobe photoshop, budgeting, customer relations, detail oriented, imaging, java, legal, macintosh os, mapinfo, matlab, meeting facilitation, microsoft excel, microsoft office, microsoft windows, problem solving, procurement, scanners, spss, sql, telephone skills, unix, user interface design, web site production, writing Experience Senior IRB Associate Stanford University June 2015  – Present (3 months) Palo Alto, California Clinical Trials Facilitator Stanford University June 2014  –  June 2015  (1 year 1 month) Stanford, California • Created extensive regulatory documentation, including eProtocol applications and informed consents 
• Interacted with financial specialists and Research Management Group to facilitate grants and contracts 
• Led project to interface with multiple team stakeholders, including CCTO leadership, to build a RedCap database from scratch for internal use by coordinators, facilitators, financial specialists and OnCore professionals with diverse needs 
• Managed the Children’s Oncology Group (COG) regulatory documentation (revisions and renewals) and facilitated CIRB audits Clinical Research Coordinator Stanford University August 2010  –  June 2014  (3 years 11 months) Stanford University • Independently managed, facilitated, implemented and executed all aspects of the SPRINT study protocol with minimal supervision, including: regulatory, documentation development (including case report forms), tracking adherence, investigational pharmacy development, developing and maintaining electronic database using RedCap and obtaining/reporting adverse events documentation 
• Oversaw all creative advertising and public relations for recruitment, resulting in top 10 recruitment national ranking (7/100+ sites) 
• Designed complex scheduling and data collection tools to record thousands of individual variables 
• Coordinated, communicated and planned strategically with stakeholders, including regulatory, finance and medical personnel spanning multiple Bay Area health care systems  
• Designed implementation of protocol, managed facilities and assisted billing manager at off-site location with grant and contract compliance; closely involved with all clinical trial finances 
• Hired and managed a team of 2-6 coordinators, administrators and interns under demanding, time-constrained situations while successfully negotiating the needs of patient safety and satisfaction Research Assistant Medical University of South Carolina December 2009  –  May 2010  (6 months) •	Assisted with analysis of raw quantitative data for distribution among a diverse audience, including policy makers and industry professionals 
•	Maintained and expanded complex data sets 
•	Assisted in design of website, including user interface, data elements and overall design 
•	Coordinated with other assistants for variety of tasks such as planning meetings and coordinating schedules. Study Coordinator University of Alberta June 2007  –  September 2009  (2 years 4 months) Study Coordinator, “Clinical, Magnetic Resonance and Genetic Biomarkers of Cognitive Decline and Dementia in Parkinson’s Disease”, June 2007 – September 2009 
 
•	Conducted phone and in-person interviews, cognitive assessments and dementia screenings 
•	Set up MRI screenings and facilitated scanning and all image/spectroscopy acquisition 
•	Tracked 102 participants’ health and related issues over two years 
•	Managed all budgeting and procurement 
•	Collected, organized and archived all study-related data 
•	Scheduled and administered all aspects of the study 
•	Examined trends in data using SPSS, MATLAB and Excel Research Assistant Patrick A. Shea, P.C. October 2006  –  February 2007  (5 months) •	Researched several ongoing legal projects, conducted phone interviews 
•	Oversaw all provisional/absentee ballot counts and recounts to ensure fair election practices, maintained written account for public record 
•	Multi-tasked under stressful, detail-oriented situations involving clients Research Assistant Department of Psychology, Carnegie Mellon October 2005  –  January 2006  (4 months) •	Evaluated and recorded problem solving in ambiguous algebraic operations Intern/Contributor Times Review May 2004  –  August 2004  (4 months) •	Researched and composed articles for four local newspapers 
•	Conducted interviews from a variety of sources, including local government representatives Intern Department of Marine Sciences, SUNY Stony Brook June 1998  –  August 2000  (2 years 3 months) •	Designed and implemented a self-directed project cross-breeding several species of copepods 
•	Developed sophisticated laboratory skills including PCR and gel electrophoresis

Summary A self-motivated, detail-oriented team player with excellent customer service, communication, and organizational skills who is able to assist with and lead multiple projects simultaneously to provide analytical, technical, and professional support to investigators, IRB members, and staff. Summary A self-motivated, detail-oriented team player with excellent customer service, communication, and organizational skills who is able to assist with and lead multiple projects simultaneously to provide analytical, technical, and professional support to investigators, IRB members, and staff. Experience IRB Manager Stanford University November 2013  – Present (1 year 10 months) Palo Alto, Ca --Conduct detailed reviews of new expedited and exempt protocols and protocol modifications to ensure compliance to institutional policies, and state and Federal regulations. 
--Approve minor modifications. 
--Provide outstanding customer service to researchers and their staff, as well as IRB Panel members, by telephone or by composing clear and concise written correspondence, using tact and good judgment.  
--Coordinate with other IRB staff as a team to ensure that issues are resolved quickly and professionally, and meet the needs of the research community promptly and accurately. 
--Able to meet deadlines (maximum 2-week turn-around for each submission) in a team setting by coordinating with the IRB associate to ensure timely review and approvals. 
--Make human subjects research determinations as needed. IRB Associate Stanford University December 2012  –  October 2013  (11 months) Palo Alto, Ca --Review and process IRB and SCRO Continuing Review forms via Stanford's eProtocol application for expedited and full board medical protocols in accordance with Federal regulations and institutional policies. 
--Review and process Determination of Human Subjects forms in accordance with Federal regulations and institutional policies. 
--Provide outstanding customer service to researchers their staff, as well as IRB Panel members, by telephone or by composing clear and concise written correspondence, and using tact and good judgment.  
--Coordinate with other IRB staff as a team to ensure that issues are resolved quickly and professionally, and meet the needs of the research community promptly and accurately. 
--Train new IRB associates. Compliance Analyst University of California, Riverside August 2010  –  November 2012  (2 years 4 months) Institutional Review Board:  
--Conduct and draft detailed pre-reviews of all new research proposals (including exempt protocols, and non-human subjects research determination and amendments/modifications to research protocols as needed or assigned) to ensure compliance to campus and UCOP policies, and state and Federal regulations. 
--Provide written and oral professional and technical support for human subjects research. 
--Manage files and prepare compliance/approval documents for authorized official execution. 
--Coordinate and prepare agenda materials for monthly IRB meetings. 
--Give educational presentations to the IRB monthly, the campus research community quarterly, and students in a classroom setting when requested. 
--Lead the development of an eprotocol IRB application. 
--Able to meet deadlines in a team setting to complete large, complex assignments, such as applying for and obtaining AAHRPP accreditation and reaccreditation. Assistant University of California, Riverside August 2010  –  November 2012  (2 years 4 months) --Purchase equipment, memberships, and other requested items. 
--Reconcile the Procurement Card activities. 
--Work with various departments to ensure compliance with campus policies 
--Process and approve laboratory personnel training and access. 
--Maintain security and training compliance database. 
--Provide excellent customer service to investigators and research staff to resolve security, building, and training issues on a daily basis. 
--Manage recruitment procedures and Worker’s Compensation claims. 
--Lead and assist in complex projects. 
--Supervise student assistants. Administrative Analyst University of California, Riverside March 2007  –  July 2009  (2 years 5 months) --Conduct and draft detailed pre-reviews of all new research proposals (including exempt protocols, and non-human subjects research determination and amendments/modifications to research protocols as needed or assigned) to ensure compliance to campus and UCOP policies, and state and Federal regulations. 
--Provide written and oral professional and technical support for human subjects research. 
--Manage files and prepare compliance/approval documents for authorized official execution. 
--Coordinate and prepare agenda materials for monthly IRB meetings. 
--Give educational presentations to the IRB monthly, the campus research community quarterly, and students in a classroom setting when requested. 
--Lead the develop of an eprotocol IRB application. 
--Able to meet deadlines in a team setting to complete large, complex assignments, such as applying for and obtaining AAHRPP accreditation. 
--Attend PRIM&R Conferences as an IRB Staff Member. 
--Process renewals and approvals for the IACUC. 
--Assist in non-IRB Compliance Committee meetings as necessary (IACUC, IBC, COIC).
